title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 931.1 - Purpose and Effect of Regulations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 931.1 - Purpose and Effect of Regulations

State Regulations
(a) The purpose of these regulations is to
establish the procedures and conditions for approval and acceptance of payments
related to the attendance, registration, travel, lodging, and food for
specified New York State officials and employees when such persons are engaged
in activities, or are providing services, that are part of their official
duties. (b) The effect of these
regulations is to supersede prior regulations and any advisory opinions or
other guidance issued by predecessor agencies to the joint commission on public
ethics to the extent such advisory opinions and guidance are inconsistent with
this part. Notes

Adopted, New

York State Register, Volume XXXVI, Issue 24, effective
6/18/2014

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
